Question: A freshly baked loaf of bread at a temperature of 200°C is left to cool in a room with a constant ambient temperature of 19°C. The rate constant \(k\) for the cooling process, according to Newton's Law of Cooling, is found to be \(0.034 \, \text{min}^{-1}\). Calculate the temperature of the loaf after 8 minutes. Provide your answer in °C and rounded up to three decimal places.
